header.title: Our beloved national cardgame — modernized
header.description: No installation, no ads and free. Or as we say in swissgerman: De Foiver und s'Weggli

features.title: Yass Features
features.subtitle: Card mats and wooden tile backgrounds are reserved for the pub.

earlyBird.title: Early Bird
earlyBird.description: Yass is still heavily under construction. Join from the start and help shape development in the right direction with your feedback.

noAds.title: Open Source
noAds.description: Yass is open source, ad-free and you can play at no cost. If you find a bug, I'd love your pull request!

fastSimple.title: Fast & Simple
fastSimple.description: Intuitive interface, quick response times and multi-language support - that's my goal for Yass.

betaRoadmap.title: Beta Access & Roadmap
betaRoadmap.abstract: Its finally time! Yass enters the public beta. Find out how you can help with testing and what else is planned for the future.
betaRoadmap.aiDisclaimer: Note: This page was mostly translated by AI from the German original. If you spot any translation issues, please let me know!
betaRoadmap.intro: It's finally here! For the past 3 years I've been trying to find time for «Yass» here and there, and finally there's a version worth showing to the world.
betaRoadmap.statusP1: To make sure the release isn't a total disaster, I rely on your help testing the current state of the application.
betaRoadmap.statusP2: A quick anecdote: When I first showed the app to a colleague after 2.5 years of development, he simply said: «Sidney, you do know we play jass counter-clockwise, right?». Ouch!
betaRoadmap.statusP3: If you find a bug, you can report it anytime. Whether it's spelling errors in the text, bugs in the game logic, or something confusing in the user interface - I'm happy about every report.
works: Login as guest or with email and password
Create a game and play either to a point total or number of hands (against <1/> bots or with <2/> a partner)
Join a game via QR code or game code
Presence of all players shown via small circle: <1/>, <2/>, <3/>
Play cards, weisen, schiebe, trump, Stoeck
buildSites: The bots are absolute jass beginners. This is partly because I'm not really a good jass player myself, and partly because I've only implemented a few heuristics so far. The system is there and can be extended as needed.

Many code improvements that don't affect functionality much (Kotlin update, migration away from context, removing the legacy «Skin» system, performance optimizations, improved monitoring/alerting, etc.)
betaRoadmap.roadmapIntro: Yass is nowhere near where I want it to be. The following features are planned for the near future:
roadmap: Strong focus on multiplayer: automatic opponent search, leaderboards, and game history
Blog: detailed posts about the architecture and how developers can run their own version of Yass
Bot Intelligence: improved heuristics and Monte Carlo simulation to make bots real opponents
betaRoadmap.futureIntro: A few long-term ideas that are swirling around in my head:
future: Custom Bot Development: The ability for developers to write their own bot and test it against other bots and real players.
Tournament System for organizers, clubs, or companies to easily host online Jass tournaments
